channel.title: Bill Wurtz – Questions
channel.description: Unofficial RSS feed for Bill Wurtz questions page

item.description: 1:04 am What are you up to this year? any fun plans? i dont plan exactly by year, but i have some ridiculous plans for both the near and distant future

2:23 am What's the difference between a connoisseur and an aficionado? "connaisseur" is from french, meaning expert/judge/taster. "aficionado" is from spanish, it means a fan/enthusiast of something but it also means 'amateur'. The meanings of those 2 words may have merged together a little when used in english, but looking into french and spanish i can see that perhaps the connaisseur may perhaps be a little more high brow than the aficionado

3:07 am any tips on how to reconcile with something you have to live with forever? it might be possible to use it to your advantage. ultimately that is the best way to handle these things, if at all possible

3:24 am what does your average bass fx chain look like? any tips or warnings for people envious of your mixing? it probably will help a lot to clear the bass frequencies away from the non-bass instruments during times when the full band is playing. single out the instruments that are really doing the low frequency job (bass, kick) and let them have the low end, and keep that mostly out of the other instruments. this can help a lot. and also compressing the bass (not have a lot of loud-soft range) will help usually help. for some reason, wide loud-soft range is usually not too useful on the bass

item.title: 1.14.26 6:29 am
item.description: have you ever thought of making a full length album? yes but i'd rather just make many many many songs

item.title: 1.14.26 6:57 am
item.description: What is your favourite jazz chord hot take there is no such thing as a 'jazz chord' and also a different chord is favored at each moment of the music

item.title: What are you thoughts on banjo?
item.description: i've used it in probably the majority of my songs. it's incredibly groovy. so in this case i apologize, if you have ever listened to my music, for all the banjo in it

item.title: I know it has its use cases and wouldn't want to tell anyone what to play bc who the heck am

item.description: 7:25 am I've always felt banjo is a bit of a subpar instrument. I mean, it produces a unique kind of sound so this fact alone justifies its existence, but to me it always lacked some richness and sexiness that comes from other stringed instruments like guitar. (Side note I just realized - banjo is kinda like a reverse bass. Or maybe ukulele is)
8:10 am how many digits of euler's number do you memorize i dont know any of it. havent looked into it yet. i would have but i've been busy making music etc for a long time
8:13 am favorite philosopher? surprise me

item.title: another way to look at it (and also not the only way), for example, is: in the past, most animals have had to brutally f

item.description: 8:19 am have you heard of the new instinct-vs-intellect explanation of the human condition and do you think it's probable? basically that our ape ancestors were completely instinctively orientated to love, but that when they developed a conscious mind it clashed with the instincts, causing it to become psychologically upset which is the mad state we still suffer from today and have for eons tried to free ourselves from i think that's a bit of storytelling and it's certainly not the only way to look at it.
10:15 am what do i say at the interview to make them want to hire me one classic trick is to ask them questions
1:14 pm can I count on you to live as long as possible. yes i believe so. i'm very serious about my work, which is intimately connected to being alive
1:24 pm sorry if this is a rude question but i suspect you'll answer when the time is right: will people be seeing, hearing and feeling new videos from you soon? yes i believe so

item.title: 1.14.26 1:25 pm
item.description: What's your favorite Pokémon? the.... yellow one
1:57 pm Is the sun 5 nanometers away? from what, nevermind, no i dont think so
2:37 pm what is the best substitute for curtains .... shades?
2:49 pm How do you feel about the word cabbage phonetically? I personally enjoy the sound and texture of it. it's good but not as good as "cribbage"

item.title: 1.14.26 3:35 pm
item.description: How much time does it typically take for you to respond to a question after it is asked? let's see, donderdag 15 januari 2026 22:27:13 maybe about 31 hours, for example
3:44 pm do you ever think feelings, or feel thoughts? now we're talkin
4:10 pm What is your favorite month and why is it the one you choose? whatever month it currently is
4:16 pm wat is mgic to u? as in hw u dfine it magic is a word i sometimes use to describe other things
4:20 pm i just ate some carrots it was about a 6/10 experience wait i lied it was actually 6.5 it was pretty fun i'm following along with the story so far
4:37 pm oxford sent me a rejection letter yesterday, should I reject their rejection letter this could get out of control
8:13 pm what exact date will you release a new song many dates but it will probably be a weekly schedule or something similar

8:35 pm how do i actually make music? i like making fun sound on the piano but i look into making music and its just piles of words i dont understand.. so how do you go from "oh this sounds nice" to a completed song? at some point it's worth asking yourself what you feel a completed song should be. Do you feel other songmakers have gotten it right, or deep down do you wish it was a little different?
8:50 pm Why do we call them cookies if we specifically bake them? some sort of language mixeroo. as usual
9:20 pm what is something that is not a pyramid scheme "fair and square"
9:25 pm would you ever not be a princess i was going to say yes but now that i think about it no
9:48 pm what if i just made a statement instead of a question so crazy it just might work
11:39 pm Who is going to win the super bowl? the NFL

12:45 am Should I tell my crush that she has the power to break the patterns that torment her? sure but it might be hard to convince her that you also wouldn't mind if she broke those patterns without you

1:10 am Ive been playing guitar for a while and ive also recently started playing bass. Im still not too good at guitar even after having played it for a year already, and im new to bass so that's obvious how I'm doing. Have you got ANY good tips for continuing my learning of music in general, or anything specific about those instruments? you're going to figure out it all anyway, and it's going to be way more fun than if i tell you the wrong thing at the wrong time
2:40 am what is your operational definition of "near future" i suppose it's all relative
6:37 am How many Christian communions do you think one would have to attend in order to have consumed one entire Jesus? sometimes you can get it all in one
8:00 am Thoughts on anarchy? surprisingly organized

item.title: could you tell me?
item.description: no because you could always change your mind after i predict
9:33 am I forgot what I was going to say
11:20 am thoughts on raging bureaucracy? seems pretty chill
12:18 pm do you like rain? in moderation

2:27 pm Hello, I just wanted to thank you for something. See, someone I knew recently died of something that almost killed me, and I've been having a horrendous time dealing with all of the things my brain is doing about it. I was feeling exceptionally not OK, went on YT to watch some cat videos to try to calm down, and saw one of your videos in my recommendations. I decided out of curiosity to see which of your videos were released around the time I was sick. And I found out that you posted "if the world doesn't end" right when I was... not quite well yet, but through the dark and experiencing the miracle that I had survived. It helped end a panic attack (so did the cats.) It's so strangely comforting. So I just wanted to thank you. Please keep being weird and amazing. I suppose I need a question here, so... what do you want to do if the world doesn't end? make a huge pile of songs that is twice as high and twice as important as all the others before
5:24 pm hey I forgot what my last question was what was it? was it this
5:42 pm Do you have any interesting tales from the creation of the music and/or video of outside? had the chorus/title idea first

8:02 pm the person who said banjo is subpar... what? they've certainly not heard it in the genre, and it can sound quite sad and wistful and profound in the right song. now my question for you: is there an instrument you feel you've underutilised or not used at all but would want to include more? jeans, for sure
8:09 pm what is the answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything? a book quote.... which sometimes even overshadows the book it's from

item.title: ue
item.description: q stions
